title: Voluntary Codes of Conduct
description: Consider adhering to voluntary codes of conduct for minimal risk AI systems.

title: General Software Best Practices
description: Apply standard software development best practices, including security and quality assurance.

title: Data Governance Practices Documented
description: Are there documented data governance and management practices for training, validation, and testing datasets? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 10.2)

title: Dataset Relevance & Quality Assessed
description: Is there evidence that datasets are relevant, representative, free of errors, and complete for the system's intended purpose? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 10.3)

title: Bias Examination & Mitigation Processes
description: Is there evidence of processes to examine and mitigate possible biases in datasets? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 10.3, 10.4)

title: Data Processing Operations Documented
description: Are data processing operations (collection, labelling, cleaning, enrichment) documented? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 10.2, 10.3)

title: User Information on AI Interaction
description: Are users clearly informed when they are interacting with an AI system, especially if there's a risk of confusion with human interaction? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 13/52)

title: Information on Intended Purpose & Capabilities
description: Is clear information provided to users about the AI system's intended purpose, capabilities, and limitations? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 13.3a, 13.3b)

title: Information on Accuracy & Risks
description: Are users informed about the system's level of accuracy and any known or foreseeable risks associated with its use or misuse? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 13.3c, 13.3d)

title: Instructions for Use Provided
description: Are clear and adequate instructions for use provided to the user, including information on how to interpret outputs and potential risks of misinterpretation? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 13.3g, 13.4)

title: Design for Effective Oversight
description: Is the AI system designed and developed to enable effective human oversight, including appropriate human-machine interface tools? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 14.1, 14.2)

title: Information for Overseers
description: Are individuals assigned to human oversight provided with adequate information and tools to understand the system's capabilities, limitations, and monitor its operation effectively? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 14.3, 14.4a, 14.4b)

title: Intervention Capabilities
description: Does the system allow human overseers to intervene in its operation, decide not to use the system in particular situations, or override its decisions? (Ref: EU AI Act, Art. 14.3c, 14.4c, 14.4d)

title: Oversight Measures Documented
description: Are the human oversight measures, including their implementation and any specific training for overseers, documented?
